profileAlternative.name: David Golub
profileAlternative.headline: Staff Software Engineer at MongoDB
profileAlternative.summary: I am currently a Senior Software Engineer on the Cloud Services Team at MongoDB in New York City, where I work on the development of the core components (e.g. REST API, alerts, billing, users/groups) of MongoDB Cloud Manager, MongoDB Ops Manager, and MongoDB Atlas and serve as the Windows specialist for the team. Previously, I worked at Organic Motion as the primary developer of the OpenStage SDK and BackStage client software. I am also the developer of CMake Tools for Visual Studio, an open source Visual Studio extension providing syntax highlighting and IntelliSense for CMake. I hold the degrees of Master of Science and Bachelor of Science, both in computer science, from Columbia University and Yale University, respectively. My undergraduate program also included extensive coursework in mathematics. Prior to beginning full-time work, I completed an internship at Fog Creek Software. I also have experience in academic research and open source development.

I hold the degrees of Master of Science and Bachelor of Science, both in computer science, from Columbia University and Yale University, respectively. My undergraduate program also included extensive coursework in mathematics. Prior to beginning full-time work, I completed an internship at Fog Creek Software. I also have experience in academic research and open source development.

positions.title: MongoDB
positions.description:
Ported MongoDB Cloud Manager and MongoDB Ops Manager to Windows.
Developed public REST API for MongoDB Cloud.
Developed billing system for MongoDB Cloud Manager and MongoDB Atlas.

Title
Software Engineer
positions.description:
Ported MongoDB Cloud Manager and MongoDB Ops Manager to Windows.
Developed public REST API for MongoDB Cloud.
Developed billing system for MongoDB Cloud Manager and MongoDB Atlas.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
Wrote majority of code for OpenStage SDK and BackStage client software.
Developed video viewer to play video files in Organic Motion's proprietary format.
Developed infrastructure for offline tracking of videos.
Developed web-based interface for managing OpenStage vision processors.
Set up, maintained, and administered build server for continuous integration.
…
see more

positions.title: Intern in Software Development
positions.description: Developed new features for Kiln, a Mercurial-based source code control system.

positions.title: Lab Assistant
positions.description:
Performed research on computer vision for medical robotics and grasping.
Wrote code for camera calibration and triangulation of 3-dimensional points.
Devised, implemented, and tested several approaches to track the position of a robot snake.
Worked full-time during the summer and part-time during the academic year.

positions.title: Yale University
positions.description:
Performed research on kinematic learning, the ability of a robot’s software to determine the robot’s physical structure using a stereo vision system, avoiding the need for it to be pre-programmed.
Wrote code to implement various computer vision algorithms needed for the project.
Derived equations to find the kinematic parameters of each joint of the robot from the data obtained through vision.
Worked on upgrade of hardware and drivers for humanoid robot.
Worked full-time during the summer and part-time during the academic year.
…
see more

positions.title:
Title
Student Technologist
positions.description:
Assisted students at the university with computer problems, performing repairs such as virus
removal, data recovery, OS reinstall, and hardware replacement.
